alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:39PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN FRANKLIN, NORTHEASTERN RIPLEY, NORTHERN DEARBORN, NORTHWESTERN HAMILTON AND SOUTHWESTERN BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 138 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Brookville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Fairfield, Forest Park, Harrison, North College Hill, Batesville, Mount Healthy, Brookville, Bright, Ross, Oldenburg, Taylor Creek, Dry Ridge, Blue Jay, Dunlap, Skyline Acres, Colerain Township, Lake Santee, Logan and Reily. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 145 and 171. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
